intro: Ammi ferulifolium, commonly known as the common cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. It is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic properties. Ammi ferulifolium is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in other open habitats.
